elements.title: pizza to North Korea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kim Jong Il had Italian chefs flown into Pyongyang to introduce pizza to North Korea (example pictured)?

elements.title: Church of St John of the Collachium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Church of St John of the Collachium was said to contain the hand of John the Baptist, a bowl used by Jesus, and a piece of the True Cross?

elements.title: LA LOM (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that LA LOM named many of their songs after various locations in Los Angeles?

elements.title: Nuwhaha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Nuwhaha people, despite sometimes being erroneously known as the "Upper Samish", do not speak the Samish language?

elements.title: Betty Hanley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Betty Hanley, originally a Michigander, was appointed lampshade designer to the British royal family?

elements.title: Motokare Retry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the spin-off episode of the live-action adaptation of Motokare Retry was written to portray "conversations between men" and "male friendship"?

elements.title: United States Pavilion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the 1964 New York World's Fair, police officers used computers at the United States Pavilion to help arrest people?

elements.title: Qupanuk Olsen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Greenlandic content creator Qupanuk Olsen petitioned the Inatsisartut to move Greenland's time zone to UTC−03:00?

elements.title: rails in Canberra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that many an Xplorer has traversed the rails in Canberra?
